Key Arguments: The legislation threatens personal freedoms, including free speech and personal sovereignty.
It grants excessive power to unelected officials to control internet discourse.
The government's handling of COVID-19 was misleading and stifled public debate.
The government's narrative on COVID-19 origins and vaccine efficacy was deceptive.
The legislation would allow the government to push its version of facts without scrutiny.
Main Themes: Criticism of COVID-19 policies and communication
Notable Quotes: This proposed legislation is the most dangerous ever tabled in the Australian Federal Parliament.
Throughout the COVID-19 incident of 2020-2023 the Australian public was patently subjected to direct government interference and stifling of public debate.
In no way should the Australian government and its related departments be given any more control or power over free speech in this country.
